article.headline: Texas Southern 83, Arkansas-Pine Bluff 80, OT
article.story: HOUSTON (AP) -- Dominique White hit a half-court shot at the buzzer to give Texas Southern an 83-80 overtime win over Arkansas-Pine Bluff on Saturday night. The Golden Lions took an 80-77 lead on a free throw with 56 seconds left. But a 3-pointer by Sollie Norwood, his fourth of the game, tied the score at 80 with 20 seconds left. Arkansas-Pine Bluff missed a 3-pointer with 2 seconds remaining. The ball went out-of-bounds, giving the Tigers (13-11, 9-4 Southwestern Athletic) one shot to win. The inbound pass went to White, who launched the winning shot as he crossed the half-court line. White's shot was just his second field goal of the game. He finished with six points and eight assists. Chris Moore led the Tigers with a double-double -- 19 points and 11 rebounds. Jacques Jones and Norwood scored 18 points apiece. Leonta Matthews finished with nine points and nine boards. William Byrd scored a game-high 23 points for the Golden Lions (8-17, 6-8). George Davis came off the bench to score 14. Larry Williams and Terrance Calvin each scored 11.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
